snippet: Mary Woods, 56, was homeless, addicted to crack and prostituting herself to pay for it. Getting arrested in 2009 changed the course of her life for the better.
abstract: Community Service Society, one of seven organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund provides Mary Woods of Manhattan, with $336 for three monthly MetroCard as she struggles to recover from drug addiction.
lead_paragraph: Mary Woods, 56, was homeless, addicted to crack and prostituting herself to pay for it. Getting arrested in 2009 changed the course of her life for the better.

headline.print_headline: A Grandchild’s Love Quells the Demons of Addiction
headline.main: A Grandchild’s Love Quells the Demons of Addiction
